column4: ok -.- question: i have shared folders, every time i try to DELETE the shared folders from the "System > Administration > Shared Folders" they refresh... why? -.- ....
*temporarily use RAM as diskspace
Are they located on the system you used to delete them? Or a remote one
yeah, i'm on the system i used to delete it: it keeps refreshing after i delete it
How are you going about trying to delete them.
You should do it from the terminal so it will give you error output
i'm still a newb... guide me, haha - commands?
Is it a folder or a file
i'm trying to remove a folder i shared... and it doesnt delete from the "System > Administration > Shared Folders" menu....
ohhhhh go to properties of the folder you are trying to delete
somewhere in there it should give you the file location/source
oh, i'm just trying to remove it from being Shared.... not deleting the whole thing
indeed.
it's a learning experience, my friend.
haha, yeah ... i was just trying to share between two computers...
did it not work out?
sometimes windows and linux don't like to share with eachother at first
i was trying to share linux with linux o.O
well its sharing now... but i needa know how to remove the shared folders afterwards.... :/
Oh, nvm. Most people roll in here with windows-linux networking probs
find the physical location of the file, not the vertial veron of it in the shared folders manager
well.. i found the real folder, i click properties, i hit "do not share" i hit ok, and its still sharing
